telegraph.diagnostics.dea.tabulate_dea_overlap(*inputs) → pandas.DataFrame

telegraph.diagnostics.dea._interpret_dea_features_gprofiler(features, **kwargs)
telegraph.diagnostics.dea.interpret_dea_features(input: pandas.DataFrame | List[str], method: Literal[g:Profiler] = 'g:Profiler', **kwargs)
telegraph.diagnostics.dea.plot_top_k_enrichment_results(*dfs, name_col='name', value_col='p_value', value_is_p_value=True, max_name_len=None, top_k=20, id_col='tg_id')

Plot top K enrichement results

Will plot the top_k enrichment results from an enrichment analysis (e.g., provided by the function interpret_dea_features).

Parameters:

  • dfs – pd.DataFrame (unlimited number)

  • name_col – column where the geneset/pathway name can be found

  • value_col – column where the values to sort by/pick top k from can be found

  • value_is_p_value – whether values are p-values or not

  • max_name_len – maximal number of characters of geneset/pathway name to be printed in plot

  • top_k – number of top pathways to plot

  • id_col – column to split analysis by

Returns:

Plots the top K genesets/pathways using matplotlib
